Container.Name: LastOasis
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Last Oasis and run it.
**Customer & Provider Key:** You have to first create your own Provider Key here: https://myrealm.lastoasis.gg and fill in the generated Provider Key and Custom Key in the template.
**After the first server start:** After the first sever start you can mange your server at: https://myrealm.lastoasis.gg you should see your server there. Create a Realm, Add and Activate a Tile and wait for the server to load it, after that you can join your dedicated server (keep in mind that every Tile needs it's own dedicated server and each dedicated server needs it's own Provider Key!).
ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. If you want to install a static or beta version of the game change the value to: '920720 -beta YOURBRANCH' (without quotes, replace YOURBRANCH with the branch or version you want to install).

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: Customer Key
Config.Description: Your Customer Key goes here (You can get your Customer Key here: https://myrealm.lastoasis.gg Log in -> click on the Hosting drop down and select Providers).

Config.Name: Provider Key
Config.Description: Your Provider Key goes here (You can get your Provider Key here: https://myrealm.lastoasis.gg Log in -> click on the Hosting drop down -> select Providers -> click Add Key -> enter a Name and click Add).

Config.Name: UDP1 - Game Port
Config.Description: UDP Game Port (if you need another port delete this entry and create a new Port mapping with the same Port for the Host and Container Port, also don't forget to change the port value in the Game Parameters!)

Config.Name: UDP2 - Query Port
Config.Description: UDP Query Port (if you need another port delete this entry and create a new Port mapping with the same Port for the Host and Container Port, also don't forget to change the QueryPort value in the Game Parameters!)

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
